data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person must always face forward to reverse the direction of the step. Take 9 steps left. Turn and point your ego to the right. Attempting to reverse the direction of the step means facing inwards and returning to the original direction. So, the answer is yes.

Turn around you get back to the starting point. The answer: yes.

You start at the beginning then at the end you return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

The starting point is at the farst point. The direction is left. If you take 7 steps, and take 1 step backwards, you come to the beginning point at the farst point. So, the answer is yes.

Once you have taken 10 steps, you can take 10 steps right up to the starting point. Also, you can do the following except you take 9 steps first. Therefore, the answer is Yes.

Turn around and turn right is the same as turn around and turn right. So, the answer is yes.

If you complete the process you go 6 steps to your starting point and 8 steps to go to your starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you always go forward. If you take 1 step left, you always go left. If you take 4 steps forward, you always go right. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Take 2 steps first and then 3 more to get back to the first place. The final answer: Yes.

Since you always face forward, and one step backward carries you to the starting point, you still take 3 steps forward before going backwards again. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first step in any sequence means you are facing towards the right. So, you have to take 7 steps backwards. The second step in any sequence means you are facing towards the left. So, you have to take 5 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you want to do a backwards step, your way back to the starting point is the front of the diagram. If you don’ t want to do a forwards step, your way back to the starting point is the front of the diagram with the starting point going forward. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, one would automatically return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

A person always faces forward and they take 1 step backward. If they always face forward, that means they always take 3 steps right. They take 6 steps left. A person always takes 1 step forward and they take 3 steps right. So, the answer is yes.

The first instruction is not correct. 1 step backward is a different type of step backward than taking one step forward. The first instruction is written the same way as the first one. However, it has more numbered steps than the other two. So, the answer is No.

If you take 4 steps inward, you take 4 steps out. If you take 7 steps left, you take 7 steps left. When you take 4 steps forward, you are returning to the starting point. All the steps do not involve going back to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

Place the starting point on the other side of the room where you are facing forward.

These steps begin with one forward step – 5 steps right, 3 steps left, 1 step forward, 1 step forward, 2 steps forward and 3 steps left. They add up to 90 total steps, hence 3 steps left. Whenever you take a step, a sequence of steps repeats itself. They add up to 3 steps with 4 steps right in each step. So, the answer is Yes.

Every step forward is a return to it's starting point. To take 10 steps forward you must take 8 steps forward as well as take 10 steps forward. To take 7 steps backward you must take 7 steps backward as well as take 10 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Face forward until the first step is taken and proceed to always face forward. Once you are facing towards right, then take 10 right steps. Once in the same direction, then there are 3 to 3 4 forward steps. To take a step left, go back to 1 step left and the same direction. So, the answer is No.
